titleStmt.title: Three Hundred Dollars Reward: A broadside issued by William K. Ish and Joseph L. Hawling to recover three slaves
three hundred dollars reward a broadside issued by william k ish and joseph l hawling to recover three slaves
titleStmt.author: William K. Ish and Joseph L. Hawling

projectDesc.p: Prepared for the University of Virginia Library Electronic Text Center during course 16, "Introduction to Electronic Texts," Rare Book School, July 1995

editorialDecl.p: All quotation marks retained as data
Spell-check and verification made against source and printed text using WordPerfect spell checker
Keywords in the header are a local Electronic Text Center scheme to aid in establishing analytical groupings

refsDecl.p: ID elements are given for each page element and are composed of the text's unique cryptogram and the given page number, as in AusEmma1 for page one of Jane Austen's Emma.

change.item: Proofed and corrected against the original text.
Corrected title and changed text id to conform with existing catalogue record.
Converted SGML to XML. Fixed tagging.

respStmt.name: Ethan Gruber, University of Virginia Library

change.item: Converted XML markup from TEI Lite to uva-dl-tei (TEI P4 with local customizations).

respStmt.name: Greg Murray, University of Virginia Library

change.item: Programmatically updated TEI header markup (but not header content) for minimal compliance with current QA requirements.

respStmt.name: Scholarly Resources, University of Virginia Library

change.item: Added and/or replaced the digital images accompanying the electronic text. Scanning of exterior and interior (ie. pages) of item was done only for items found in the University of Virginia Special Collections Library.

note.p: Large ink spot on upper left center of document.

div1.p:
Brokeout of jail in Leesburg, on Monday morning, the 10th of June, three Negro men, named
BOB, CHARLES, and ALFRED. Bob and Charles are owned by the subscriber, W. K. ISH,
and Alfred owned by the subscriber, JOSEPH L. HAWLING. Bob is a bright mulatto, about 18 years old,
well made, and about 5 feet 6 inches high—no particular mark recollected, except of a ring-worm on one
cheek, which at times is more strongly marked than at others.

CHARLES is about 6 feet high, with large full eyes, has rather a bashful countenance, and is quite
slow in speech—no particular mark recollected; color rather a light brown; age about thirty.

ALFRED is a very stout well-set man, about 26 years of age, and very black, and 5 feet 7 or 8 inches
high—his lips are unusually thick—speaks fast and his manner, with persons not well acquainted with
him, would be deemed saucy; clothing not recollected.

We will give the above reward for all three, if taken out of Virginia, or $100 for either of them; or
if taken within Virginia, $50 for either—$100 for two, or $150 for all three; if lodged in jail, so that we [may]
get them again. Direct to either of the subscribers, at Middleburg Post Office, Loudoun County, Va.
div1.signed:
WILLIAM K. ISH,
JOSEPH L. HAWLING. Leesburg, June 10, 1839
